publications.name: Coconut Libtool: Bridging Textual Analysis Gaps for Non-Programmers
publications.summary: We introduce Coconut Libtool, an application for analyzing textual data without the need for programming skills, suitable for researchers and students in fields such as social sciences and humanities, and also without the need for installation.

publications.name: Adding Perspective to the Bibliometric Mapping Using Bidirected Graph
publications.summary: This research attempts to examine a relationship from two sides: whether the values that emerge when x → y and y → x are different or the same, in order to enrich the analysis.

publications.name: Exploring Final Project Trends Utilizing Nuclear Knowledge Taxonomy: An Approach Using Text Mining
publications.summary: I have classified the final project documents of a university based on the taxonomy of nuclear knowledge. This is beneficial in reducing the workload of librarians and serves as a consideration in determining the appropriate subjects.

projects.name: Coconut Libtool
projects.summary: Web-based tool for helping and accelerating library service. From librarians to librarians. The Coconut Library Tool is the all-in-one data mining and textual analysis tool for librarians or anyone interested in these applications. Our tool does not require any prior knowledge of coding or programming, making it approachable and great for users who want to test out these data analysis and visualization techniques.
